title: [Large-Scale] Measuring Product Development Process Complexity and Workload Analysis Based on NASA-TLX

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of product development processes, engineering problem-solving methodologies, and foundational VR simulation usage experience
context.additional_context: Practice-centered education using a smartphone-based VR environment. Aims to improve product development efficiency by measuring cognitive load during complex problem-solving processes.

learning_goals: The NASA-TLX scale can be used to quantitatively measure task workload at each stage of product development.
Learners can explain methods for analyzing the complexity of the product development process in a simulation environment.
Based on designer cognitive load data, learners can propose optimization strategies for the product development process.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
